title: Opportunity Attack

markdown:
# Opportunity Attack

You can make an opportunity attack when a hostile creature that you can see moves out of your reach. This is the most common use of a [[reaction]].

## Making an Opportunity Attack

To make an opportunity attack, you use your reaction to make **one melee attack** against the provoking creature. The attack occurs right before the creature leaves your reach.

## When You Can't Make Opportunity Attacks

You **don't** provoke an opportunity attack when:

### Teleportation
- The creature teleports or is otherwise moved without using movement, speed, or action

### Forced Movement
- The creature is pushed, pulled, or moved by an external force (like *Thunderwave* or being shoved)

### Disengage Action
- The creature takes the Disengage action before moving
- Disengage prevents opportunity attacks for the rest of that creature's turn

### Special Movement
- Certain features allow movement that doesn't provoke opportunity attacks
- Example: Mobile feat, Swashbuckler's Fancy Footwork

## Breaking Free

Some creatures can move through your reach without provoking:
- **Flyby**: Some flying creatures can fly out of reach without provoking
- **Mobile Feat**: You don't provoke opportunity attacks from creatures you've attacked this turn
- **Cunning Action (Disengage)**: Rogues can Disengage as a bonus action

## Special Opportunity Attacks

### Polearm Master
- Can make opportunity attacks when creatures **enter** your reach (if wielding a polearm)

### Sentinel Feat
- Opportunity attacks reduce target's speed to 0
- Can make opportunity attacks even when target takes Disengage
- Can use reaction to attack creatures that attack your allies

## Multiple Creatures

If multiple creatures move out of your reach:
- You can only make **one** opportunity attack per round
- You choose which creature to attack
- You must use your reaction, so you can't use it for anything else that round
